subject: Augustus IUpdate
event: We're not out of the woods yet, but Gus has been showing definite signs of improvement down at the animal hospital in Albuquerque.  He's eating again, and responding well to treatment.  The docs still don't have a firm diagnosis, but they've ruled out several of the worst possibilities.  If his improvement continues, he might be able to come home tomorrow night.

comments.article:
*thinking good thoughts as hard as i can*

best wishes to all of you.

Yay! It's good to hear things are getting better. I know how frustrating it can be to not know what is wrong with a pet (and if only they could tell you their exact symptoms!!).

My parents dog (who I am close to since I picked her out!) spent about 3 weeks total in the vet 2 summers ago, a few times they told us they didn't think she'd make it through the night. We STILL don't have a diagnosis but she's improved considerably with diet changes!

So it sounds like there are some of the "worst possibilities" remaining? I hope he ends up being alright!

My parents' cat (who basically likes me the most when I go home to visit) got shot (yes, I'm serious, SHOT) this past summer probably by some neighbor in the tail and hasn't been the same since. She's constantly licking the wound even 6 months after and lots of it seems quite likely it is still possible to be infected... it's really sad, so I can totally relate to your situation. I hope Gus feels better!

i hope your parents' cat gets better soon.  maybe the vet can help clean up the wound, although cat's saliva does have a lot of healing properties in it.  i wonder how that neighbor (some neighbor!!) would feel if he or she got shot.  sending my best wishes to your parents' cat!!

I hope that Gus feels better.  I pay for expensive food to keep my kitties healthy; it helps, but ultimately they only live a fraction of our time.  My cats are smarter than many people; and they take the time to notice other people, play, and pray.  We named one of our cats Pangur  (after the Irish poem... that cat that chases mice while the monk chases after a word).  Another cat spent his nights curled around my head; I'm constantly cold since he passed away.  Children grow into nagging adults, but cats play around the corners of memory; they're worth every purr.
comments.subject: Get well, Gus.

comments.article: I wish your kitty the best. They truly are the best of friends.
little cat. My cat nearly died three times before she weighed in at half a pound so don't worry. They're resillient little buggers.
comments.subject: get well soon

comments.article: get well, gus!  the cat and dog food recall included expensive dog and cat food.  i would check out the food that he eats.  i know the recall was a while back, but i don't put it past "them" to try again.  i hope for the best.  please send him all of our good wishes!!

and kept other friends informed who don't have that 'news junkie' gene that I do. One friend did have one of the recalled foods in her pantry, thankfully, she hadn't opened that case yet, and my warning may have saved her elderly kitty.

I found a bag of kitty treats in our pantry that had been recalled. But I had never opened the bag, our guys are rarely interested in treats, preferring caviar and wild Scottish smoked salmon. Took the bag and ground up the contents in the garbage disposal rather than risk some innocent wild creature finding it at the dump.

I still hope to see people go to jail and companies compensate the thousands of people who lost their cats and dogs because of their neglience.
comments.subject: oh, believe me, I triple checked the foods they eat
Re: oh, believe me, I triple checked the foods they eat
Re: oh, believe me, I triple checked the foods they eat

comments.upictitle: bronxelf (The NYC Chamber of Commerce in Chucks.): winter 2014
comments.article: Very glad to hear that he's improving. :)  Hopefully 2008 will be better for cats than 2007.
Yay! Undiagnosed illnesses are the worst, but coming home is always good...

Best wishes. I remember how upsetting it was when my cat was injured. The most distressing thing was that she seemed to lose all her spirit - just lay there limp without even trying to do anything. I hope Gus recovers quickly.
Fingers crossed Gus gets home soon. :)
I lost my old man cat last year (Got him as a kitten when I was 10, so it was his time), so I'm hoping that Gus makes it home!!!
Miss Kitty Calgary sends the very best of thoughts to Gus, via the kitty network. Us, as well.
I'm really glad Gus is doing better now, it's certainly a good sign that he's regained his appetite. Hopefully they find out what's wrong with him and you'll get him back home soon.

Phew. I thought your silence on the subject might have meant the worst.

Hoping for a steady recovery for Gus!
comments.subject: More relieved

comments.upictitle: Paul Wickham: Knight in shining armour
comments.article: The return of Gus's appitite is good news indeed. I hope he continues to improve and is home with you soon.

comments.upictitle: Xray Is As Xray Does: ethelclose
comments.article: That's encouraging news, that Gus is gaining something of an appetite back. May he continue to improve with each day.
That's great.  Sick kitties don't eat (nor do a lot of sick people for that matter!).  Go Gus!

Glad to hear the good news. Way to go, Augustus!

Sending good thoughts your way.
Good luck Gus!

Really good news.
Keep it up gus! :)

comments.upictitle: Mr. Cryptic Poster: Good Ol' Steve
comments.article: I lost my dog of fourteen years on New Years day and I can sympathize on how hard it is to see a loved pet suffering and sick.  I hope and pray for a speedy and full recovery for Augustus.
Pets grow into family members. Their suffering is ours. I'm sending good vibes for Gus and you folks.
That's good news! Best wishes to all of you.

Best of wishes to you and Parris, and hope that Gus comes home soon. My wife is a very experienced veterinary technician, so if you get the diagnosis back and need any advice on how to care for Gus, let me know.
I'm sure there's a cat macro to express joy over another cat's recovery from imminent demise, but I'll just say that's good and leave it at that.
